title: EU Commits €100M to Improve Competitiveness of European Space Industry
summary: The European Commission announced 10 September that it has signed an agreement with SPACE AISBL to co-manage the European Partnership for Globally Competitive Space Systems initiative. Referred to simply as the Space Partnership, the initiative aims to identify key priorities to invest in to accelerate the development of the European space industry. SPACE AISBL was […]

title: The future of Boeing’s crewed spaceflight program is muddy after Starliner’s return
summary: "The final chapter on Starliner has not been written yet."

title: The invisible battle for space dominance
summary: As geopolitical tensions extend beyond Earth’s atmosphere, the U.S. Space Force is sharpening its focus on dominating the electromagnetic spectrum. Space electronic warfare — the art and science of protecting […]

title: Soyuz MS-26 poised to fly NASA and Roscosmos crew to ISS
summary: The Soyuz MS-26 crewed mission is set to fly NASA astronaut Don Pettit and Roscosmos cosmonauts Alexey Ovchinin and Ivan Vagner to the International Space Station (ISS). Launch is scheduled for Wednesday, Sept. 11, at 16:23 UTC from Site 31/6 at the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. The Soyuz spacecraft will reach the ISS just over three hours later, with docking expected at 19:33 UTC.

title: NASA Stennis Set to Continue ASTRA Mission with Sidus Space
summary: NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, announced Wednesday it will continue its historic in-space autonomous systems payload mission aboard an orbiting satellite through a follow-on agreement with Sidus Space, Inc. “We are excited to report the historic ASTRA (Autonomous Satellite Technology for Resilient Applications) mission will continue,” said Chris Carmichael, chief, Stennis […]

title: U.S. space weather policy is alive and well but is insufficiently funded
summary: Policy is not the impediment to increasing space weather preparedness in the United States; the lack of funding is. U.S. space weather policy is alive and well under the continued […]

title: NASA astronaut Don Pettit to make fourth trip to the International Space Station
summary: Pettit will fly to the orbiting outpost alongside Russian cosmonauts Alexey Ovchinin and Ivan Vagner on the Soyuz MS-26 mission. Liftoff from the Baikonur Cosmodrome is set for 12:23 p.m. EDT (1623 UTC).

title: Astroscale and ClearSpace get funds to advance double satellite de-orbit mission
summary: The UK Space Agency has awarded funds to consortiums led by Astroscale and ClearSpace to continue developing a servicer capable of removing two spacecraft from low Earth orbit in 2026.

title: Report highlights severe infrastructure challenges at NASA
summary: A new report concludes that infrastructure and workforce challenges will soon require NASA to make tough choices about what missions to continue to conduct unless it receives a significant budget increase.
